intro: Spartothamnus hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's spartothamnus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually fleshy and covered in a waxy layer to reduce water loss. Spartothamnus hookeri is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
